author: Daniel Lee
title: The Best Way to Learn Gun Safety Is With Real Guns
text:
Recently I found a fascinating remnant of America’s long relationship with guns: a 1956 Life magazine photo essay about a conservation officer teaching firearm safety at an Indiana elementary school. The officer shows the kids his service revolver, a shotgun and a high-powered rifle. He lets 7-year-olds handle the guns, draw their bolt actions, feel their heft compared with the plastic toys they have at home. The kids’ awe and excitement sets their faces alight.
